summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGarnier SkinActive Micellar Foaming Face Wash is an all-in-1 oil-free face wash that gently foams to remove makeup, cleanses and refreshes.
details: DetailsBenefitsThis oil-free, fragrance-free, paraben-free foaming face wash cleanses skin and removes makeupGel face wash gently foams to remove face and eye makeup and leaves skin feeling refreshedMicellar Foaming Cleanser rinses clean without harsh rubbingSuitable for all skin types, even sensitive skinFeaturesOil-free, Paraben-freeItem 2522607How To UseApply on wet skin and gently massage into a lather. Rinse off. In case of direct eye contact, rinse thoroughly with water. Use morning and night.IngredientsAqua/Water, Glycerin, Peg-200 Hydrogenated Glyceryl Palmate, Coco-Betaine, Sodium Laureth Sulfate, Polysorbate 20, Peg-7 Glyceryl Cocoate, Citric Acid, Cocamide Mea, Peg-55 Propylene Glycol Oleate, Polyquaternium-11, Ppg-5 Ceteth-20, Propylene Glycol, Sodium Benzoate, Sodium Chloride, Sodium Hydroxide, Vitis Vinifera Fruit Water/Grape Fruit Water. F.I.L.# B189874/1.
how_to_use: Apply on wet skin and gently massage into a lather. Rinse off. In case of direct eye contact, rinse thoroughly with water. Use morning and night.
ingredients: Vitis Vinifera Fruit Water/Grape Fruit Water. F.I.L.# B189874/1

reviews.headline: Absolutely love
reviews.comments: I didn't know what I was missing in face wash until I tried this one. This product works really well with my combination skin. Removes makeup and oil. No issues at all!

reviews.headline: Every time I stop using this and replace it, I break out
reviews.comments: There is something magical about this and idk why. This doesn't trigger fungal acne or acne. Every time I try to replace this for a more a more trendy product, I break out. I always have clear glass skin when I use this. I use this as a first cleanse in a double cleanse routine. Every time I use an oil cleanser or a balm, I get acne. And regular micellar water is cool and all, but it takes more effort and dries my skin out. This doesn't. This is perfect. And it really cleans my pores. Every time I have one of my girlies sleep over, they use it and tell me they love it. PLEASE DONT DISCONTINUE. YOU JUST NEED BETTER INFLUENCER MARKETING ON TIKTOK FOR THIS CAUSE IT REALLY IS THAT GOOD. It removes makeup and spf so easily for a first cleanse. I used to have glass perfect influencer-like skin and when I stopped using this I started having bad skin. And when I decided to recover my bad skin and revert back to this, it started healing. Genuinely so crazy how this is the corporate for genuine good skin and a proper cleanse.

reviews.headline: ✨Holy Grail✨
reviews.comments: I tried the mini Micellar waters and none of them would take of my eye makeup. No matter how much micellar water I used, my mascara wouldnt come of. I then tried this cleanser and not only did all of my mascara come of, all of my makeup came of with just one pump! Highly recomend!

reviews.headline: I would buy this again
reviews.comments:
I really like this face wash 
It removes my makeup and makes my face feel better 
I just hate that it took 12 days to be delivered! 
I feel that is unacceptable and will not be ordering for it to be delivered

reviews.headline: simple, effective, non drying
reviews.comments: i hate using cotton pads to remove make up  (im lazy + its wasteful) so i wanted a simple cleanser i could use in the shower. i dont like cleansing balms (i feel like i can never wash them off) and most foaming washes are way too drying. this is PERFECT. it doesnt strip my skin whatsoever and it removes all my make up. it even washes away my very oily heroine make mascara remover (iykyk). 10/10 reccomend.

reviews.headline: Good for every day
reviews.comments: I have acne prone skin and was just looking into a face wash that could remove sunscreen and light make up which this does do the job. Oil cleansing breaks me up but micellar water doesn't so I figured I'd try the cleanser. I'm pretty happy with it.

reviews.headline: New fav for acne-prone, combo-oily skin
reviews.comments: Bought this on a whim because ive had such success with the micellar water from Garnier. So glad I gave it a try! I add a small pump to a damp washcloth and massage it around my face to remove makeup and greasy grossness, then wipe again with the clean side of the damp cloth. I've noticed decreased breakouts and blackheads since using. Only downside I've found is that it does sting a bit if you get it in your eyes… Big deal.

reviews.headline: Best for removing makeup
reviews.comments: This is my go to for washing my makeup off at night. It's very gentle and thicker than just miceller water and takes off every trace of makeup gently. I have only been able to find if at ULTA.

reviews.headline: Does what it says
reviews.comments: This product is what it says it is.

reviews.headline: The Wash
reviews.comments: I always buy this and I have for years.. Love it and it's very gentle on your face...

reviews.headline: Amazing stuff
reviews.comments: I havw oily skin and I swear by this. I oil cleanse first with jojoba oil, use this, then follow with cereve gentle wash. My skin has never been better.

reviews.headline: Decent
reviews.comments: Works well getting face makeup off but struggles with waterproof eyeliner and mascara. I also find it to be a bit drying so I don't use it very much, but my partner loves it. Leaves skin feeling clean at least.

reviews.headline: Not as good as the micellar water product
reviews.comments: This product works best when I apply it directly over my make up, over the directions that mention to rinse face w/water to begin. It does not lather/foam. My hopes were high for this product bc I love the micellar water removal. Lastly, this product doesnt smell too good.

reviews.headline: Love this product!
reviews.comments: Definitley one of my favorite products. Genlte, cleans the face and removes the makeup great! Loveeee it!

reviews.headline: Prefer this more
reviews.comments: I much prefer to be able to rub my skin with my fingers instead of a washcloth because of how sensitive my skin is and this is much cheaper than cleansing balms from other brands. It works just as well as the micellar water by garnier!

reviews.headline: My new staple face wash!
reviews.comments: It removes my makeup better than any other cleanser and my face feels smooth and refreshed aftward. Get it.

reviews.headline: So Good
reviews.comments: This is always my first step of makeup removal. It goes really far and truly does a good job of actually taking it off. Removes waterproof eye makeup in seconds. I use this before going in with my daily cleanser for a full clean, but there's almost no need, as this really gets rid of almsot everything.

reviews.headline: Not good at all
reviews.comments: I was exicted about this becuase i love micelar water from this brand but this is terrible. It doesnt take off makeup easily, stings your eyes, and you need like 4 pumps to wash your face. Dont buy

reviews.headline: Love
reviews.comments: A little goes a long way. Love it!!

reviews.headline: Took a chance
reviews.comments: Not too bad for cleansing my skin especially after wearing makeup or working out. I'm a fan of Garnier products anyone and this one doesnt disappoint either.

media.caption: Not too bad for 59

faceoff_positive.comments:
I want to preface this review by saying that I'm nearly 42 years old, and it's only in the past couple of years that I felt like I didn't have the skin of a teenager.  My skin is very oily, and until I finally figured out a routine that would work, was very prone to breakouts.  With that being said, I was going to be very picky about changing my routine and trying a new product.  My first impression of the Garnier Micellar Foaming Gel Cleanser upon feeling the thin consistency of the product was, "How is this really going to cleanse my skin?"  I must say, it lives up to it's claims of gently removing my makeup.  Even though it wasn't a thick as cleansers I've used in the past, it easily and gently cleansed my skin.  I usually used a couple of pumps of product and gently massage it with water into my skin.  After rinsing, my skin was clean, but not tight like harsher cleansers tend to make it.  It was soft, supple and  clean.  I didn't feel like I still had makeup left behind on my skin.   

The one drawback (and the reason I'm rating this a 4/5) is that it didn't remove my eye makeup like I'd hope it would.  It did break it down, but I was usually left with black smears around my eyes from where my mascara wasn't completely removed.  In the before/after picture I've attached, I did use baby oil to remove my eye makeup before finishing with the Garnier Micellar Foaming Gel Cleanser.  That combination worked well and made me feel like I was truly going to bed with a cleansed face.  

Overall, I didn't notice any negative changes to my skin.  It felt clean, kept breakouts at bay, and didn't increase the oil production of my skin.  This is definitely a new way of cleansing my face and I would recommend that others of all skin types try it as well.
faceoff_positive.headline: You can teach an old dog new cleansers!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I kept hearing great things about micellar water cleansers, and I'm always looking for simple and non drying ways to remove makeup and wash my face.  I'm sorry but this was terrible.  I very rarely wear mascara, which there is no WAY this would remove it if I did, this couldn't even remove eyeshadow.  It's literally the worst "cleanser" I've ever used.  I'm also not very prone to breakouts, and this caused me to breakout!! As in multiple zits!!  I don't recall the last time I had ONE zit, let alone several! Judging by how it didn't remove makeup, I'm thinking it didn't remove anything at all, and the breakouts were probably caused my dirt, oil, and other buildup.  I think the 10 days or so I used this was as if I didn't wash my face for 10 days!! It also smelled horrible.  Sort of like perfume, but also sorta like just straight up "fumes", like turpentine or something?? Really weird.  Oh, and I almost forgot to mention, the pump broke off the first time I used it, and I was having to pour it out.
All around horrible, I would never recommend this to a friend or even an enemy.
faceoff_negative.headline: Awful
